speaker: Frasier
text: I just had the most wonderful time today.

speaker: Nancy
text: Me too.  It's funny that we worked together all that time and we never dated before this.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, anyway I...

speaker: Roz
text: Hey, Frasier!  Nancy, hi!

speaker: Nancy
text: Hi!

speaker: Roz
text: So, are you back to work yet?

speaker: Nancy
text: Almost, I start at KNFS tomorrow.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, Roz, Nancy and I are having coffee.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, none for me, thanks. [_to waitress_] Listen, can I have a fat-free muffin please?  Nancy, I have been dying to call you. My cousin just moved to town and I think he'd be perfect for you!

speaker: Nancy
text: Actually, I just started seeing someone.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, you'll forget all about him when you meet Chuck.  He is so handsome and rugged and he loves the outdoors...

speaker: Frasier
text: Kindly leave him there.  You see, the person that Nancy is seeing is me.

speaker: Roz
text: Really?  You two are dating?

speaker: Frasier
text: Even as we speak!

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, my God!  I am so sorry.  Well, good for you.  I mean, who needs Chuck when you've got... well, the anti-Chuck? [_She gets up_] When my muffin gets here, could you send it over?

speaker: Frasier
text: You won't even see it coming.

speaker: Roz
text: OK...

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, where were we?

speaker: Nancy
text: Well, I think you were about to ask me out again.

speaker: Frasier
text: My gosh, so I was.  Well, let's just see how far this ESP of yours goes: what night was I thinking of?

speaker: Nancy
text: Friday night.

speaker: Frasier
text: Astonishing!  Busboy, clear these spoons before she starts bending them.

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, I am so glad you're here.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: [_spotting Nancy_] Oh, sorry.  Niles Crane.

speaker: Nancy
text: I think we've met.  Nancy Cavanaugh, I used to work at KACL.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, of course.  Talking business?

speaker: Frasier
text: Uh, well, actually no...

speaker: Niles
text: [_sitting down_] Oh, good, I was afraid I was interrupting something.  Here, feast your eyes on this! [_He hands Frasier a document._]

speaker: Frasier
text: "Financial Settlement."  Good lord, Niles, you and Maris have come to terms?

speaker: Niles
text: What's that?  I couldn't hear you over the angels singing.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, congratulations!  That is exciting.  My, ah, brother's been going through a rather rancorous divorce.

speaker: Nancy
text: You must be very relieved.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, I'll say.  It's cost me a fortune already.  If she dragged it out any longer, I'd be literally bankrupt.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I'm sure you've got some celebrating to do, so off you go.

speaker: Niles
text: I cannot wait until I'm done with this.  I just have to sign it and get her to do the same and then I can take my seat aboard the freedom train.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, all aboard!

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, it's a funny thing: one day you're starting a new relationship, full of hope.  The next you're sinking helplessly into a sucking pit of despair that leaves you filled with the bitter bile of regret.

speaker: Niles
text: You're on a date, aren't you?

speaker: Frasier
text: It's hard to say at this point.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, I am so sorry.

speaker: Nancy
text: [_getting up_] It's all right, I have to go, anyway.  It was nice seeing you again.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, you too.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_hissing at Niles_] What the hell is wrong with you?!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, here we are.

speaker: Nancy
text: So, are we still on for Friday night?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, of course we are.  You know, I was wondering...maybe we could just, uh...

speaker: Nancy
text: Have dinner at your place?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, that's amazing.  You read my mind again.

speaker: Nancy
text: Well, I just thought it would be more comfortable.  We could curl up on the couch, make a nice fire...

speaker: Frasier
text: Can you guess what I'm thinking now?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, you ARE good, aren't you?   **LOVE ME TWO TIMES**  _Scene 2 - Frasier's Apartment Fade in.  Martin is in his chair, Daphne has a basket of laundry. Niles and Frasier come in._

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, guys.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hey there.

speaker: Daphne
text: So, who won the squash game?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Daphne, it's not about winning or losing, it's about the thrill of the competition.

speaker: Martin
text: Congratulations, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Thanks, Dad.  Pumped as I was, I don't think anybody could have beat me today, even an actual athlete.

speaker: Frasier
text: Sherry, Niles?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, thank you.  Maris and I have reached a financial settlement.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, ho!  That's great!

speaker: Daphne
text: This is wonderful!  Well, as wonderful as the tragic ripping apart of two lovers once bound in a sacred union can be.  Oh, it's brilliant, Dr. Crane.

speaker: Niles
text: Thanks Daphne.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Daphne, as long as you're doing the laundry, let me throw in my gym towel.

speaker: Daphne
text: All right.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, if you've got a couple of extra minutes, I can also give you these squash togs.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, let's save some of the fun for tomorrow.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_pulling a box from his bag_] What's this?  Cartier!  Niles, did you put this in here?

speaker: Niles
text: No.

speaker: Frasier
text: My goodness, someone must have slipped this in my bag while we were in the courts.  That's odd, I don't remember anyone touching our bags except the valet and Jaime, the squash porter.

speaker: Martin
text: Boy, you guys work up quite a sweat down there, don't you?  _Inside the box is a smaller one nestled in shredded paper. Frasier opens it._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, my goodness, Niles, look at this. [_He gasps._] Cufflinks! They're beautiful.  There's a card in here.  "I still think of you constantly.  I was wrong to ever let you go.  Do you believe in second chances?"  It's unsigned.

speaker: Martin
text: Wrong to let you go.  It sounds like it's from someone who dumped you.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, that's no short list, is it now?

speaker: Martin
text: You know, maybe it's that Sonya woman he was goin' out with.

speaker: Daphne
text: Wasn't there a sister, too?

speaker: Martin
text: And a niece!

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, yes, he went through that family like a recessive gene.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well, not to disrupt the think-tank, but there is an easier way to find out.  I'll just make a few well-placed inquiries and see where I get a nibble. [_He gets his address book out of the desk._] Ah, yes, there's a group of people that might regret leaving Club Frasier before last call. Oh, yeah, Patricia and there's oh, Susan, yes.  Tatiana, oh boy...

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, all during squash the only thing you talked about was this wonderful new woman in your life, now you're just going to drop her to chase after someone else?

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm not dropping Nancy!  I'm just, uh, I'm uh...

speaker: Daphne
text: Weighing your options?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, all right, so what if I am?!

speaker: Niles
text: I don't believe this!

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, all of my life, I've dreamt of the day when I would be pursued by more than one woman.  What man hasn't?  For God's sake, do you blame me for enjoying it now that the day is here?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, all of my life I have heard you whine about your dating woes.  Now you have a chance for something good with Nancy and you're going to risk ruining it?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, you are just jealous, that's what you are.

speaker: Niles
text: I am not jealous.  You're being foolish.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, come on.  Nonsense.

speaker: Niles
text: Dad, what don't you agree with me?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, fine, let's just ask Dad.  Dad what do you think?

speaker: Martin
text: [_getting up_] Noooo, no.  Don't drag me into this.  I learned when you were kids to stay out of it whenever you two started fighting.  I'd just wait 'til the whole thing ended, usually in tears, then I'd take you both out for ice cream. [_to Daphne_] That was my job: ice cream man.

speaker: Daphne
text: I suppose fathers are the same everywhere.  Mine couldn't bear to see us fight.  If there was so much as a peep out of us, he'd be out the door to the pub.  Stay for a few hours, sometimes overnight.  Then, when they brought him back the next morning, we couldn't fight because of his headaches.  I suppose that was part of his plan to keep harmony in the family.  God bless him.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, Daphne, wait up.  I'll ride down with you.  Frasier, you have a chance for something real with Nancy.  Only a fool would throw that away chasing after some-

speaker: Daphne
text: It's here!

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, wait for me! -pie in the sky. [_leaves_]

speaker: Frasier
text: What an idiot. [_He dials the phone._] Tatiana.  Frasier Crane here.  Pick up if you're there.  Well, I guess I've missed you.  Question is: have you missed me?  _Fade out.  Scene 3 - Cafe Nervosa. Fade in.  Roz is at a table, Frasier joins her._

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, hi Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hi, Roz.  Why so glum?

speaker: Roz
text: Why else?  The weekend's starting again and I don't have a date.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh.

speaker: Roz
text: Do you know how long it's been since... you know.  I've probably forgotten how.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Roz, I'm sure it will come back to you.  It's just like riding a bicyclist... bicycle.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, you're in the same boat, why don't you come over and hang out with me and Alice tonight?  I'll rent a movie and we can order pizza...

speaker: Frasier
text: Gosh, I'd love to, but I've got a date tonight with Nancy.

speaker: Roz
text: That's still goin' on?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, as a matter of fact, we're going out tonight on our THIRD date.  You know the kind: it's like one of your FIRST dates.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, ha-ha.  Well, I gotta go.

speaker: Frasier
text: All right.

speaker: Waitress
text: You're Dr. Crane, right?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, I am.  Can I help you?

speaker: Waitress
text: [_putting down another gift box_] A woman dropped this off for you. [_She goes back to work._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, my gosh, it must be another gift from my secret admirer.

speaker: Roz
text: You've got a secret admirer?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, I do.  In fact the other day, she sent me these cuff links.  At least, I think it's the same woman, unless a third person has thrown her hat in the ring.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, my God.  You have two women?

speaker: Frasier
text: At least.

speaker: Roz
text: And you're juggling them?  And you're getting jewelry?

speaker: Frasier
text: Why is that so hard to believe?

speaker: Roz
text: Well, I guess since they cloned that sheep, anything's possible.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: Hey, guys.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, Fras.

speaker: Niles
text: Hey, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, Niles!

speaker: Niles
text: [_as he and Martin sit_] What is that?  Oh, not another gift from your mystery woman.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_opening it_] Yes, yes, indeed it is.  Oh, my God.  It's a Patek Phillipe pocket watch!

speaker: Niles
text: That is stunning!  I almost bought one like that on my honeymoon, only Maris thought it was too impractical, so we got that Glockenspiel instead.

speaker: Martin
text: So, who do you think this stuff is from?

speaker: Frasier
text: Gosh, I haven't smoked her out, yet, but she certainly has exquisite taste.  She doesn't have a bad eye for jewelry either! [_laughs_]

speaker: Martin
text: He was like this last night.  It was all I could do to keep my beer down.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_noticing a woman_] Well, looky there.  No, not yet. That's Tina Dalton.  We dated last summer.  And now it turns out she's in the cafe just as this little bauble arrives...

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, before you go over there...

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, please, I have had enough of your finger wagging. I am doing what any red-blooded American man would do.  For God's sake, there's nothing wrong with playing the field.

speaker: Niles
text: It looks like you've been eating the field.  What did you have for lunch?

speaker: Frasier
text: Pesto.  Oh, my God!  I better go freshen up.

speaker: Martin
text: [_fussing with the shredded packing paper_] Huh.  Look at this mess.  Ah, it's too bad it's not bubble wrap.  Ha!  You don't know what funny is until you've seen Eddie go after a sheet of that stuff.  Poppity-pop-pop-pop!  He gets all scared and runs away, and then he screws up his courage and comes back again, and - poppity-pop-pop! - he runs away again.  Yeah, I watched him for an hour one time. You know, it's amazing how entertained he can be by somethin' so simple. [_pause, then_] Poppity-pop- pop-pop! [_laughs_] _Niles just stares at him for a moment with a look that combines familial concern with analytical fascination.  Then he notices something._

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, my...

speaker: Martin
text: What is it?

speaker: Niles
text: This card that came with the gift.  Frasier must not have noticed it.  "Missing you every moment, my dear sweet Niles."  Do you realize what this means?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, yeah.  You're the one with the secret admirer.

speaker: Niles
text: And a pretty nice watch, too! [_He opens the case to look at it._]

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I don't get this, how could this happen?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, the other gift was left in Frasier's squash bag, which is exactly like mine.  And, I guess today the waitress must have mistaken Frasier for me. [_excited_] You don't suppose it's Daphne?

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, she took a second job washing that old Mrs. Lumpkin's hair just so she can give you Cartier.  Besides, the note said it's someone you've been with.

speaker: Niles
text: There's been so few women since Maris.  So few women before Maris.  Hence there was Maris.

speaker: Martin
text: I'll bet it is Maris!  You said yourself you saw that watch on your honeymoon.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, that's absurd.  Dad, we're in the process of finalizing our divorce.

speaker: Martin
text: [_to the waitress_] Excuse me, miss?  Do you remember the woman who brought this box in?

speaker: Waitress
text: Yeah, she was very well dressed and really, really thin.

speaker: Niles
text: That could be a lot of people.

speaker: Waitress
text: Yeah, she just dropped off the gift then ordered a whole- milk mocha with whipped cream and chocolate shavings.

speaker: Niles
text: [_laughing with relief_] Oh, thank God.  That's not her.

speaker: Waitress
text: Yeah it was really weird, though.  She just took a long whiff of it and then just handed it back.  _She laughs at this and walks away.  Niles laughs too, but it soon turns to sobbing.  Fade out.  End of Act 1  Act 2  Scene 1 - Cafe Nervosa. Fade in.  A few minutes later, Niles is on his cell phone._

speaker: Niles
text: Well, thank you Marta, you've been very helpful. [_he disconnects_] Well, turns out Schenkman dropped Maris and now she wants me back again.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_coming back from Tina's table_] Well, that was fun!  Had a little catching up to do, but it turns out she wasn't the woman sending the gifts.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, we know, the gifts are from Maris.

speaker: Frasier
text: Maris?  Is my secret admirer?

speaker: Niles
text: No, she sent them to me.  Schenkman dumped her and, and she wants me back.

speaker: Martin
text: How do you feel about this?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, frankly, I feel a little injured.  I thought I had a secret admirer.  Well, no matter, I do have a date with Nancy, tonight.  You know, it's our third date.

speaker: Martin
text: I was talking to Niles.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh.  Oh.

speaker: Niles
text: I guess I'll just have to go over and talk to Maris and set her straight.

speaker: Frasier
text: Gee, Niles, I don't know if that's a very good idea.

speaker: Niles
text: [_putting the watch back in the gift box_] Well, I'm up to my ears in debt.  I need to sign this settlement and she'll never do that if she thinks there's any hope of us getting back together.

speaker: Frasier
text: Gosh, it just seems a little dangerous to me, confronting her when she's so vulnerable.  Don't you agree, Dad?

speaker: Martin
text: Don't ask me, I'm just the ice cream man.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, thanks a lot.  Listen, Niles, I think this whole pursuit of you has been brought on by a panicked reaction to Schenkman dumping her.  You know, give her a few days, she'll probably realize that herself.  That's the time to approach her.

speaker: Niles
text: I can't wait any longer.  Do you have any idea how insulting it is that she thinks she can buy me back with these trinkets? [_rising_] I am THIS close to being free from her financially and emotionally!  I'm going to settle this right now. [_He heads out._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, I just think you should wait! [_But he's gone_] Well, he certainly dashed out of here in a hurry.  I suppose that's a good thing.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, he's not gonna back down.

speaker: Frasier
text: That, and he forgot these cuff links.  I've got a date tonight!   **THE EGO HAS LANDED**  _Scene 2 - Frasier's Apartment Fade in.  Frasier is getting ready, Daphne is dressed up._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Daphne, thanks again for taking Dad to Niles's for me. I'd do it myself, but since you're going out...

speaker: Daphne
text: I'm going to a party three floors down from here.

speaker: Frasier
text: Gosh, I'm so sorry.  I had no idea.  I didn't mean for you to miss any of the fun.  Dad!  Shake a leg, Daphne's in a hurry.  You know, frankly I'm really glad he's going over there.  I have no idea what condition Niles'll be in after he confronts Maris.

speaker: Daphne
text: Yeah, it's a shame about Dr. and Mrs. Crane.  Seems so difficult these days to make something last.  To find someone to grow old with and share all of life's little details.  I only hope someday I find that kind of intimacy.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I'm sure you will.

speaker: Martin
text: [_coming from his room_] Daphne, where the hell is my scarf?

speaker: Daphne
text: In your sleeve, like it always is.  Now come on, we've got to get going, there's construction by the waterfront.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, we're not goin' that way.  We're takin' my shortcut.

speaker: Daphne
text: I know your shortcuts and the waterfront's faster.

speaker: Martin
text: Now don't start with me.

speaker: Daphne
text: Don't YOU start with me or I'll leave you here.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, hi, how ya doin'?  Come on in. [_Nancy enters._] And we're turnin' on my radio station in the car.

speaker: Daphne
text: Fine, it's better than listening to you talk.

speaker: Nancy
text: Is this a bad time?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, that's a bad time.  Hi.

speaker: Nancy
text: Hi.

speaker: Frasier
text: You look sensational.

speaker: Nancy
text: Thank you, so do you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, thank you very much.  Can I interest you in a glass of wine?

speaker: Nancy
text: Perfect.

speaker: Frasier
text: Lovely.

speaker: Nancy
text: I've been here before, you know.  Two years ago, for your Christmas party?

speaker: Frasier
text: Really?

speaker: Nancy
text: I don't remember this chair.

speaker: Frasier
text: Normally there's something draped over it: my father.

speaker: Nancy
text: Oh, there's a message on your machine.

speaker: Frasier
text: Must have come in while I was cooking dinner.

speaker: Nancy
text: I only mentioned it because I gave my secretary your number so she can call me about tomorrow morning's conference, in case, you know, I don't find my way home tonight.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, you just reverse the directions I gave you earlier... ohhhh.  Feel free to check the machine if you like, I'll just go stir the risotto.

speaker: Cheryl
text: [_voice over from the machine_] Frasier, this is Cheryl returning your call, and no- _Cut to Frasier in the kitchen with panic on his face.  He rushes back to the living room and we cut to follow him_

speaker: Cheryl
text: I didn't send you anything.  I thought I told you when we broke up: It's over.

speaker: Frasier
text: Boy, is that old message still on there?  Cheryl and I broke up so long ago, I can't even remember when.

speaker: Machine
text: Friday, six fifty-one PM.

speaker: Frasier
text: I know it was a Friday.

speaker: Nancy
text: Oh, well, we all have exes.  As long as it's over.  It is over, right?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, God, yes, it certainly is over.  Oh Nancy, please here, come sit with me. [_They sit on the couch._] Listen, I want to tell you I'm not interested in anyone but you. [_The phone rings._] You know, perhaps I'd better get that, it could be your secretary.

speaker: Nancy
text: Oh, let the machine get it. [_They kiss._]

speaker: Denise
text: [_v.o. from machine_] Frasier, it's Denise.  I don't know how you got my number, but I am NOT interested in dating you again.

speaker: Frasier
text: Denise!  Ha, ha, you prankster.  No.  No, no, I won't. No, absolutely not.  I promise, never again. [_hangs up_] Well, how about that dinner, now?

speaker: Nancy
text: I don't believe this.  You have been calling other women for dates!  How could you lie to me?

speaker: Frasier
text: I haven't lied to you.  Why would I lie to you?  I have nothing to hide. [_The phone rings and Frasier pushes her aside to get it._] Let me get that!  Hello?  Yes?  Oh, yes, just a moment.  It's your secretary.

speaker: Nancy
text: Hi, Gwen.  Call me in the car in five minutes.  I'm going home.  _She puts the phone down, and grabs her coat and purse.  She leaves as Frasier follows._

speaker: Frasier
text: No!  No, Nancy, Nancy, please, please don't be hasty.  I realize I've done something rather foolish.  Look, let me explain.

speaker: Frasier
text: Nancy, the truth is, I did call some other women.  I guess I was feeling insecure, a little nervous about getting close to you.  I don't blame you for getting angry and I wouldn't blame you if you wanted to leave.  It's just that I, I think we really have something here.

speaker: Nancy
text: Well, I thought we had something, too.

speaker: Frasier
text: I made a mistake.  I... give me another chance?

speaker: Nancy
text: Well, that risotto did smell good.

speaker: Frasier
text: OK.  _He ushers her back in and follows.  Before he gets all the way in, the elevator opens._

speaker: Madeline
text: Frasier!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Madeline.

speaker: Madeline
text: I got that note you left under my door.

speaker: Frasier
text: I am so sorry about that...

speaker: Madeline
text: I was so happy to hear from you.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_pulling the door shut behind him_] Really?

speaker: Madeline
text: I was just thinking about you the other day.  You know, I don't even remember why we stopped seeing each other.

speaker: Nancy
text: What is going...  This again?  This date is over.

speaker: Madeline
text: Wait a minute.  You slipped a note under my door and you were on a date with her?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, you heard her.  Technically, this date is over.

speaker: Nancy
text: Don't ever call me again. [_steps onto the elevator_]

speaker: Madeline
text: Or me, you freak!

speaker: Frasier
text: Nancy, Madeline, please give me a second chance - either one of you!  [_N.B. Brilliant tactical thinking on Frasier's part - the sort of thing that makes a woman feel REALLY special -- Mike Lee_]  _The elevator closes on his plea and he stands alone in the hall. Fade out._  _Scene 3 - Niles's Apartment at the Montana. Fade in.  Niles is setting the table, nodding as Martin talks._

speaker: Martin
text: So then Daphne takes a left on Madison.  Bumper to bumper all the way to Pike.  Then a right on Pike.  And what do you know? King Dome traffic!  So I say...

speaker: Niles
text: Dear God, this is taking forever!

speaker: Martin
text: Exactly!  So, here we are on Fifth...

speaker: Niles
text: Wait, wait, don't go away!  I'm coming. [_opens door_] Oh, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: I have just had one of the worst experiences of my life.

speaker: Martin
text: You took Madison, didn't you?  You're as bad as Daphne. Now what you should have done...

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, _let it go!_  Please come in.  How was your date?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, Nancy discovered that I had been pursuing other women.

speaker: Niles
text: How did she find that out?

speaker: Frasier
text: It wasn't hard.  You see, I pursued one during the date.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I'm sorry.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, so am I, Fras.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, thanks, guys.  I just, I should have listened to your advice, Niles.  How did things go with Maris?

speaker: Niles
text: I wish I knew.  I returned the gifts and told her there was no chance of reconciliation.  She didn't get mad.  In fact, she was eerily calm.  She just stood there with a blank stare on her face, rubbing her ocelot.

speaker: Martin
text: You know, they got a cream for that.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, maybe she'll come around.  You've given her a lot to digest.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, no.

speaker: Frasier
text: What is it?  Oh, dear God.

speaker: Niles
text: I don't believe it!  I thought I made myself perfectly clear. What is wrong with that woman?

speaker: Martin
text: Why don't you start, Frasier?  I'll jump in when you get hoarse.  _Niles opens the box and pulls the shredded paper aside.  There is a small ring box which he opens.  The only thing inside is a coin.  He picks up the card._

speaker: Niles
text: "Roses are red, your heart is fickle.  When I'm through with you... all you'll have left is this nickel."

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, _no_.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, God... she's going to ruin me.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, Niles, maybe she's bluffing.  You know, once she's signed the financial settlement...

speaker: Niles
text: [_picking up the paper_] She's not bluffing.  This IS the financial settlement.  Oh, Frasier, why did I go over there? Why didn't I listen to you?

speaker: Frasier
text: Why didn't I listen to you?  If I had I'd be sitting with Nancy right now, sipping wine in front of the fire.

speaker: Niles
text: I'll be stripped clean and devoured like an animal.

speaker: Frasier
text: And I WON'T be.

speaker: Martin
text: All right, now.  Enough of these long faces.  Who wants ice cream?  _The brothers lift their heads and look at each other.  Then, they rise and walk out the door, followed by Martin._
